pr_title: RHPAM-2617: [GSS](7.5.1) Rule logic in a RDRL file changes after importing the file as an Asset in RHPAM 7.5

timeline.message: RHPAM-2617: [GSS](7.5.1) Rule logic in a RDRL file changes after importing the file as an Asset in RHPAM 7.5

timeline.bodyText: Could you please explain why parseDrl so intensively catch and throw exceptions, however in final everything is ignored?
timeline.author: jomarko

replies.bodyText: Well..... I copied the other parseDrl(..) method originally written by Mario Fusco (so I assumed he knew what he was doing..). The new method is used to retrieve the rule's attributes. If either parsing the DRL threw an exception or it contained errors we're unable to get the attributes.
replies.author: manstis
jomarko

replies.bodyText: @jomarko I've revised the method in a new commit.
replies.author: manstis
